subtitle: This delightful dessert uses fresh cherries.

method.text: Sift the flour into a bowl. Stir in the sugar. Rub the butter in until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Stir in enough cold water to form a smooth but not sticky dough. Roll out on a lightly floured surface and use to line a 18 cm x 28cm rectangular fluted tin. Chill for 30 min.

Sift together the flour and baking powder. Cream the butter and sugar together until pale and fluffy. Slowly stir in the egg and almond essence, adding a little flour mixture if it begins to curdle. Fold in the remaining flour mixture and ground almonds until well mixed.
Line the pastry case with greaseproof paper and baking beans. Bake blind in the oven for 15 min.
Remove the paper and beans. Return to the oven and cook for 5 min until lightly browned. Remove from oven and leave to cool slightly. Reduce oven temperature to 190°C.
Spread the pastry case with jam and sprinkle over the cherries. Spoon over the bakewell mixture and smooth over the surface.
Sprinkle the top with the flaked almonds and place in the oven for 60-75 min until firm and golden brown.
Remove from oven. Leave to cool slightly then remove from tin. Leave to cool completely. Serve in slices.

title: Cherry bakewell
